document.docAuthor: Rodrigues, Bruno V. B. & Bonaldo, Alexandre B.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the species group rubripes of Corinna Koch, 1842 (Araneae; Corinnidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the species group rubripes of Corinna Koch, 1842 (Araneae; Corinnidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Bonaldo
bibRefCitation.refString: Bonaldo, A. B. (2000) Taxonomia da subfamilia Corinninae (Araneae, Corinnidae) nas regioes Neotropical e Neartica. Iheringia, 89, 3 - 148.

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURE 42. Known distribution of Corinna mourai in Southeastern and Southern Brazil. Records from Bonaldo (2000) included.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Corinna mourai
Bonaldo, 2000
: 42
, figs. 123–126 ( holotype from Curitiba, Paraná, Brazil , A. Yamamoto, MCN 9290 , not reexamined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Males of
Corinna mourai
resemble those of
C. escalvada
n. sp.
and
C. balacobaco
n. sp.
by the wide base of RTA, occupying most of ventral tibial surface; they differ from those of
C. balacobaco
n. sp.
by the absence of a median process on prolateral surface of RTA and from those of
C. escalvada
n. sp.
by the apex of RTA rounded and directed prolateraly (
Bonaldo 2000 : figs. 123–124
); females differ from those of other species with epigynal plate not projected posteriorly and with small, unconspicuous copulatory opening by the secondary spermathecae touching each other (
Bonaldo, 2000 : 125–126
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 42. Known distribution of
Corinna mourai
in Southeastern and Southern Brazil. Records from Bonaldo (2000) included.
